description:
I tried their matcha puff, brownies and financier in the matcha fest.

Financier: this is my favorite. Though the matcha flavor is very subtle, the financier itself taste so good, not overly sweetened. 

Matcha puff: I like the matcha filling better than the frosting on top. But it's just my personally preference, I generally not a big fan of cupcake style frosting.

Brownies: Matcha add some fresh feel to the relatively heavy taste of brownie. I will buy it again if I want to eat brownie :-)
author: Wenjing Y.

description: Let me tell you that there is no bakery that I love more than Choux! This place is smashing and I have already tried almost everything off the menu. The raspberry and lemon are my go-to's but the place is crazy innovative and they come out with stellar seasonal puffs all the time! I just recently found out that I'm actually not allergic to chocolate (Go figure right?!) So the chocolate puffs are next on my list. Bonus points, everyone that works there is a TOTAL babe. Check it!
author: Bryce O.

description: Ahhh!!!! These cream puffs are too good!!! We had these ordered today with the option of having different variety of flavors. I tried the raspberry with chocolate inside and I believe the second one was vanilla. Both were amazing. Co workers had lemon, custard and many other flavors. Everyone enjoyed it. A guarantee success.
author: Shabnam N.

description: If i can i would give more stars..... I absolutely love this place,  its my go to spot when craving good pastries...... definitely worth the drive from daly city.......
author: Chris B.

description: The puffs taste a bit stale and soggy. I got them after lunch and ate right away. Disappointing!
author: missy d.

description:
Cute little spot on Fillmore & Haight serving up the cutest little cream puffs! Came in around 2pm on a weekday and it wasn't busy at all. They still had a big selection available. 

I chose one of each non-fruity flavor of choux and one financier(almond cake). I enjoyed some flavors, others not so much. My top 3 were:

Salted Caramel: You get that aftertaste of salt that compliments the sweetness of the caramel custard. 

Vanilla: Very simple but delicious. Reminds me of a Beard Papa.

Creme Brulee Financier: This is my absolute favorite here! Coated with a sugar syrup that's hardened creating a crunchy exterior. Inside is moist and very flavorful.

The others I had were just ok. I did question the freshness because the the pastry was a bit too soft. The custard inside the honey lavender flavor was a bit perfumey. I ordered a box of 8 costing me 21$. For $2.63 a bite, I'd expected more.
author: Mary R.

description: It's still my favorite cream puff shop by a mile ... the owner is amazing ... her story is inspiring !!! Each day I don't have Choux I feel deprived ... But in all truth, the design of each puff is so authentic and ingredients Laura uses are simply superb
author: Vika S.

description: I have only been here once but I wouldn't bother coming again and would not recommend it to a friend. I arrived about a half hour before closing, but as another reviewer mentioned, I questioned their freshness because the pastry dough was soft rather than crisp. I enjoyed the flavors inside (I had one coffee and one vanilla) but overall thought they looked cuter than they tasted. At $2.75 each (box of 4 for $11), I'd rather have a fancy eclair for $5.50 at one of the beautiful bakery shops I know. On the positive side, it's got fat & cream in it so for that reason can't really give them less than 3 stars
author: Jen H.

description:
Ba ba da da Ba ba da da 

Cupid's got me in a choux hold. 
I know this might sound old. 

With all the bakeries around in SF,
you gotta try the sweets from this chef.

There's chouxnuts and French puffs
Matcha, yuzu and all kinds of good stuff

There's just the right amount of sweetness and cream
guaranteed these delectable treats will fulfill your dream

Better get them for the road 
cause of the no seats code
author: Virginia Y.

description: So many flavours of cream puffs. They're super tasty. I liked the Salted Caramel ones.
author: Josh L.

description: It is a tiny dessert shop but their puff tastes so good. It is a nice size so ladies don't have to worry about getting their face messy or even mess u their lipstick, we tried the salted caramel and the hazelnut. Both are extremely good, the hazelnut is not that sweet which truly amazed me. I will definitely come back for more! Each one is 2.75 dollars, trust me it is worth!!!!( also when u buy more u can save more)
author: Shuang W.

description:
Such delicate little angels trying to tempt you through the display case. 

Choux was my friend's suggestion for dessert because let's be real, they're adorable. They're mini sized and able to be gone with one bite so how could you not want to try some cream puffs? It's definitely not like Beard Papa's because these are much more smaller and not overly filled with the sweet cream. They also come in a larger variety of flavors depending on what time you come through.

Located in the Fillmore area, Choux is a bit hard to get to due to parking. Parking is all metered around the streets till 6pm Mon - Sat so be aware as you venture here. We came through on a Saturday afternoon around 2pm and was able to get parking around the corner because of the amount of construction going on and the deceiving signs. 

Service was alright. There was one lady working when we came in and she gave us a good amount of time to figure things out. I ended up spending around $18 for a box of 8 due to redeeming a reward for one free cream puff. 

Overall, it's a fun idea. It's more sophisticated and Instagram worthy, although probably not into getting all the time just because some flavors are more up top than others and a little too sweet. Sometimes a plain vanilla or chocolate is enough.
author: Venus L.

description:
Spending a day exploring the city and after lunch in Hayes valley wanted to try a little something for dessert. Found this place on yelp and was intrigued by the French cream puff idea. The shop is small (really for take out) and the cream puffs are likewise bite sized for $2.75 per price. 

There was a variety of flavors including a seasonal pumpkin one. We tried four different flavors and they were all good. 

The presentation in a gift box as well as each cream puff being perfectly crafted makes for a great hostess gift. 

Parking is a challenge.
author: Betty C.

description:
Choux is the cutest hole-in-the-wall spot in Lower Haight, so adorable it's almost out of place in Lower Haight. They serve a handful of cream puffs, of which 1-2 are seasonal, a choux-nut (cream puff donut), and pastries (they look like mini danishes).

The matcha chouxnut was a bit overwhelming because of the frosting but delicious, the custard was luscious and complemented well with the raspberry filling. Hands down my favorite was the hazelnut cream puff, could not stop eating it. The chocolate was a second favorite, but I prefer the richness of the Pacific Puff's. As expected, this puts Beard Papa's to shame. Salted caramel was good as well, I really don't think you could go wrong with any of the cream puffs.

My least favorite of all was the danishes, probably because I'm a sucker for the cream filling and it didn't have it.
author: Jess C.

description: So we came here thought that we are gonna have cronuts (donuts and croissants hybrid). A little disappointed but ordered those pastries thingy anyway. Raspberry, chocolate vanilla, pistachio and vanilla. Damn soooo good and refreshing. It's very light, cream inside is not too sweet just perfect amount of sugar and cream blend. Highly recommended.
author: Sumbal A.

description:
A totally surprising discovery: I was waiting for the 22 bus at Fillmore and Haight. I looked to my left and I see this little pastry shop. You know I had to investigate. They make these little puff pastries filled with different types of custards. Again, I'm not a pastry cream guy, but I love lemon curd. Fortunately, they had lemon puffs and of course I bought one. That was some of the tastiest lemon curd I've had in a long while. I wish they were a little closer in to the city center. I don't get out the way very often.

If you live in the area, or you're passing through, stop in and grab one of those cream puffs. I don't think you'll be disappointed.
author: Anthony W.

description: I live in Huntington Beach my cousin was recently admitted to the hospital near this bakery I wanted to find a place to deliver sweets to her & I called and was greeted so warmly but Laura over the phone she was so sweet and answered all my questions about grub hub delivery, she even recommended the amounts of items to fit nicely as a gift in each box although that meant I'd spend less money, she clearly cares about her customers happiness & has an outstanding view of customer service! She went above & beyond for me even not physically being inside the bakery!! I've never tried the sweets but they look so so beautiful & as the owner I'm sure she makes AMAZING sweets! I'd recommend this bakery highly just from my experience alone ! Thank you Laura!!
author: Mia A.

description:
This is a small bakery nestled in Lower Haight. So if you don't live in the neighborhood or drive, it's going to be a bit of a journey to get here (walking or public transportation). There is no seating inside and not much place to stand - it's literally an order and go kind of establishment. 

A Choux ("shoo") is like the cream puff version of a French macaron. It's dense in flavor and goes great with your morning tea or coffee. It's not like Beard Papas... well maybe the crunchy exterior is similar. 

I ordered a box of 4 Choux ($11) - 1 regular and 3 seasonal flavors. 

Hazelnut (regular flavor) - tasted like hazelnut and was pretty good. 

Candy apple (seasonal) - did taste like the candy apple lollipop. The top part is like a crunchy hard candy which was a pleasant surprise. I was really impressed with the presentation and design. 

Peanut butter chocolate cream puff (seasonal) - fell a little short for me. I ate this one a few hours after I left the bakery, and when I tried it, I noticed it was a little sour. I don't know if that's how they make it or if time played a factor. I also didn't like the thickness of the peanut butter cream but that's just a personal preference. 

Pumpkin (seasonal) - really good! I usually don't like pumpkin flavored desserts but this is the exception. 

I came around 3-4 PM, and most of their flavors were sold out. So I would advise to come earlier in the day. The variety wasn't as colorful as I expected (their Instagram had some blue, green, or purple toppings). So I guess those were just seasonal flavors. Nevertheless, the craftsmanship and design of each Choux is so creative that I think you should at least experience it once!
author: Ida H.

description: Small cute like store. When I say small...I mean really small. Parking is a hassle too. But all worth it...the cream puffs are little drops from heaven...so so good.
author: Sunil R.

description: The cutest cream puff desserts you will ever see! When you walk in you will see its tiny little shop where they are baking the pastries right in front of you. They look like little mini cakes but have cream inside. We tried a few and all were delicious ! The pistachio and hazelnut were absolutely to die for! If you can get a box and try a few I would highly recommend it. There is no where to sit but there is a cute little coffee shop a few doors down so we went and grabbed a coffee their and had it with our dessert outside! It was the perfect combo!
author: Sarah O.

description:
I pre-ordered cream puffs for a friend and I would say they are the yummiest little treats. They look so cute and are delicious. I am so glad I found this place. The cream puffs are absolutely of the right size since I don't prefer eating big servings of dessert in one go.
I cannot wait to go back!
author: Chestha M.

description:
Choux Bakery is where it's at! Poets romanticize about it, dancers take flight with newfound motivation, musicals are born as a whole cast cries out in song with refrains of Choux Bakery on their lips, all while Yelp reviewers simply stammer on about how great it is!

Choux is the polished precision of the French Puff Pastry. Only here, the puff parties are experimented with and interpreted with the refinement and dignity that a master pastry chef brings. Needless to say, I very much enjoyed the items we sampled at Choux Bakery. My love and I opted to try several of the most popular French Cream Puffs (le choux à la crème) as well as a couple of seasonal offerings. These French Cream Puffs were smaller and slightly denser than the cream puffs I'm used to having. I love the other variety that I often enjoy at Japanese pastry shops, and wouldn't take anything away from those, but at Choux Bakery the difference provided for a unique experience for me. I loved the texture and the more flavorful approach to Choux Bakery. And the flavors...it was as if I was experience the precise and beautiful flavors of a master chocolatier's bon bons...rich and full of distinct taste that lingered with fondness after the last relished bite.   

The shop is small and located in a neighborhood, away from the beaten path, but the trek was well worth it for me. There is not seating, just a small shop with a counter display, but I would gladly stop back by the next time I'm in town.
author: David V.

description:
Mediocre at best. Yes, they're aesthetic, but they should stick to your IG feed rather than in your stomach. 

I much, much prefer Beard Papa's tbh. Choux is definitely pricey (8 for around $20), and lacks the creaminess that I look for when I'm stuffing my face with gooey custard. The shell was also on the soft side, which suggests that the puff isn't that fresh.

But if you buy an assortment, you get to take a cute picture and sample a bunch of flavors - worth a trip, I would say.
author: Amy T.

description:
Cute little pastry shop away from the busy part of Fillmore street. I stopped by on a Sunday afternoon around 2pm, and there was no line at that time. They had a variety of cream puff flavors available, as well as meringues, gluten-free brownies, "choukies", among other items. I ended up trying:

Perry (Hazelnut Custard, Milk Gianduja, $2.50) & Laura (Acai Berry Custard & Raspberry Curd, $2.50) [https://www.yelp.com/user_local_photos?select=O0SfXg20DWaJYAAXFP9fOw&userid=76vIFZcC7owykCBjMfGVXg, https://www.yelp.com/user_local_photos?select=bPlSAzIO07NrjLalwj9GWw&userid=76vIFZcC7owykCBjMfGVXg)
-Perry (Hazelnut Custard, Milk Gianduja, $2.50): Just ok- the hazelnut flavor was too light. Skip!
-Laura (Acai Berry Custard & Raspberry Curd, $2.50): YUM- this was definitely my favorite flavor that I tried. The acai and raspberry flavors were perfect, and I loved the lightness of this puff- highly recommended!
-Choukie (Cookie Butter & Pecan): Just ok, since the choux pastry is too dense in cookie form. I also couldn't taste much of the cookie butter, and didn't like the pecan in here- skip!

The presentation of the cream puffs is amazing, but the flavor didn't quite match up to the looks of the puffs. I would still come back to give the other flavors a try if I were in the area. Parking was easy to find on a Sunday afternoon since there was plenty of street parking.
author: Amy D.

description:
Got a box of mini cream puffs for my mom's birthday. They were so darn cute, no one wanted to eat them!

The cream puff shell was perfect with just the right amount of filing. They have lots of flavors to choose from but green tea was great probably my favorite.
We also tried the strawberry donut, which was just as pretty but we enjoyed the cream puffs more.                 

If you want to make someone really happy, I suggest getting a box of cream puffs here!
author: Kelly L.

description: Such a cute shop for these little treats! This was the first time I had this dessert so I didn't know what to expect. I really did like them, I got an assortment of flavors. I met the shop owner/baker - shes so kind! She let me sample a bunch of flavors before choosing my box. My favorite were the seasonal flavors, since they're so unique! I also liked the fruiter ones - to my surprise. However, the chocolate and vanilla are classic flavors and you can't go wrong with those!
author: Brittney B.

description: I became obsessed with this place on my last visit, so this was a must this time around. A jewel box of a bakery full of mini cream puffs & meringues. Oh my!!!! I decided on vanilla & salted caramel. Tiny crunchy pillows of dough filled with cool creamy custardy yumminess. Vanilla was nice & then I bit into salted caramel.... I die. It was fantabulous!!!!!! Choux you are tres bon!!!!
author: Karen R.

description:
Watch out, I'm getting ready to rave about the deliciousness of these cream puffs. These are absolutely, positively some of the best cream puffs I have ever had in my entire life. I'm no choux puff connoisseur, but wow these were just so good. I would honestly describe these cream puffs as little slices of heaven. They all had such rich, developed flavors wrapped in a light fluffy shell. I had a really hard time figuring out which ones to get because the flavor combinations all seemed so appealing. I mean, at $2.50 a pop, the price wasn't dissuading me from buying too many :P I'm a complete chocolate fanatic so the sophie puff really stood out to me. The chocolate was well balanced, not too sweet, and had a great texture.

Service was great and the overall look of the bakery was super cute. My only regret is that I did not get more cream puffs! I suppose I will have to return for another adventure :P
author: Lakshmi M.

description: Delicious! Super yummy Choux puffs of different flavors. We got the hazelnut, chocolate raspberry, vanilla and buttercream ones. I got there at 6pm (hour before closing) and they were sadly sold out of the Choux-nuts.
author: Tina G.

description: The lemon choux is my favorite. My bfan from France also loves it. We eagerly awaited their 10:30 am opening.. as did this last in front of us. It was just enough sourness and sweetness in a puff. I will be anxiously awaiting their matcha flavor to return (which happens only a couple of times during the year). : )
author: Jenna L.

description:
Ordered a box of 4. Hazelnut, salted caramel, chocolate  raspberry..
Came here around 11:40am on Tuesday(they opened at 11:30am) No one is lining up. No wait is needed. Parking for me is easy. 

I just tried the salted caramel one. I love it. It's not that sweet. And unlike beard papa, this one doesn't have that much cream inside which is good  because i don't like that much cream. The texture outside is crispy and firm. 

The reason I gave it 3 star is because of the service. The server doesn't seem happy and patient. I asked her for suggestion. She was like everything here is good... 
When I was about to leave, there was a lady taking picture on a small table(where it has six puffs), I thought she's also a customer, so I went ahead taking pictures too. But it turns out that she works there and she was taking picture for their instagram page.   When I left, they looked at me and seemed to feel that I am weird because I took their instagram photo..
author: Tina H.

description:
It's a dainty little shop with precious-looking cream puffs, but, presentation aside, I didn't find much value beneath the surface. A bit of a snobby attitude from the staff didn't help, either.

The cream puffs here were simply a nice, albeit spendy treat. Maybe I'm completely missing some of the nuances here as opposed to macarons (where apparently I'm quite the snob), but I just didn't feel that the higher price points were justified by any perceptible improvement in quality or taste.

Indeed, the offerings here inevitably bring up a comparison with Beard Papa's cream puffs, which, although simpler, just feel so much better going down, not just because there's more of it to go down, but also because they're not as expensive.
author: Vincent L.

description:
Came here the other week. Maybe we came at a bad time, the display was almost empty and there was literally one of every flavor. I opted for hazelnut, salted caramel, pistachio and chocolate raspberry. They charge $2.50 a piece. Overall, I enjoyed the flavor of the cream filling. The salted caramel was my favorite out of the four. The shell was a lot dryer than what I would've liked. 

Their choux are adorable and picture worthy, however, I wouldn't come back.
author: Annie L.

description: I bought a set of eight cream puffs (conveniently one of every type) for a family get-together and everyone loved them. They were light and delicious, my favorite was the pistachio.
author: Jay M.

description:
After an early dinner at Hot Zushi, I checked yelp to see what dessert spots were nearby. I booked Choux forever ago after seeing their stuff on instagram.

The little cream puffs did not disappoint. They are pretty pricey. I imagine their rent is not cheap. The chounut was delicous and so much fun to eat. I shared it, but I think I buy one for myself next time. Every cream puff I tried was delicious.

I've made cream puffs at home many times, but I was impressed with how cute they made them.
author: Thien H.

description:
Tiny, tiny little shop (no seating inside) but with the most delicious cream puffs!  They are as delicious as they are beautiful.  I love the beautiful packaging as well, and that spurred me to buy a box for a friend.

Matcha cheesecake (seasonal) was our favorite.
author: Letitia L.

description:
Due to the absolute lovely weather we're having, the boyfriend and I decided to knock off one of our "must try" dessert places since we were in SF and this one was one of the closest to us at the time and most intriguing.

We had came from the farmers market at the Civic Center and we're craving something sweet, so I flipped through our list and thought "hey let's go try this place. I've never seen a cream puff store before". Which is entirely true and still try to find places where they literally only sell cream puffs. Great location although, it's kinda hard to find parking during the weekends. It's just off Filmore and Haight. So the area is great to walk around and find some other interesting stores. 

These were the cutest cream puffs I have ever seen, but definitely pricey. For 6 it will cost you $15. We weren't so excited about the flavors, so we ended up only getting 4 which cost us $10. I was surprised I had just spent ten bucks on little cream puffs and I was totally thinking "these better be the best damn cream puffs ever"....unfortunately they weren't anything special. Unique flavors and great presentation; just too over priced and overrated. 

I probably wouldn't go out of my way to come back here, but if I ever do get a cream puff craving I guess I would come back considering I haven't found any places like this one.
author: Kayley C.

description:
Thanks Bryce! Great pastries, conveniently located by Haight street.

Lots of variety of flavors and quality packaging/baked goods.
author: Evan S.

description:
I love these pastries! They're so light and airy! The cream is always perfectly balanced and ever too sweet. 

Now would I love for this to be as big as my fist so that I can gorge myself, YES. 

But on a side note, this makes for a great gift or as part of a tasting party. There's certainly a market for it.
author: Katarina M.

description: I only tried the salted caramel and vanilla flavors here. In terms of the actual taste of the cream puff it was REALLY good!! It's just quite pricy; $2.75 for one tiny tiny cream puff. I'd rather go to beard papas for almost the same price and maybe like triple the size?? It's nice to try once but I just think the price is a littleee too much. Four stars though because it was a  good cream puff LOL
author: Katherine C.

description: WOW a little ball of yummy yummy in my tummy. So good also nice little set-up everything is in House made. And if you just want to get someone something just to say thank you this is a place there's something for everyone here.
author: Michele T.

description: Nice flavour to the creme pat fillings however didn't like the pastry as much, small space, nice flavour combinations, eat that Choux bun quickly because it did not keep well.
author: Cayla C.

description:
I ordered a box of these for an event and they were a huge hit. I ordered the lemon flavor since I was running on a yellow theme, and these tasted just as good as the Choux I've had in France! 

The lemon flavor comes through very apparently, but isn't too strong or sour that it overwhelms the taste of the cream. The pastry shell is super crunchy, even after a couple of hours! Definitely eat them day of (if not minutes after purchasing) and pay attention to their storing guidelines! 

Also the girl at the counter was extremely kind and patient. I called ahead to order a box with pretty short notice so they didn't have the lemon flavor I was looking for, but the girl went ahead and made them fresh for me! I will say these are pricey, but worth getting for a treat or present.
author: Ellen M.

description: So good! Each cream puff was small, about the size of a maccroon, and well made. The pistachio was my favorite. The choukie was sweeter than expected with a nice lemon flavor. Variety of flavors with some changes during the seasons. Coffee was the perfect amount of sweetness and a perfect way to warm up and relax as you enjoy your baked goods. The baker herself mans the shop and is a delight to talk to. You can see the whole kitchen from the store front.The genesis story of her bakery is an inspiration for those who want to pursue a new dream. Very small store - cannot sit down.
author: Victoria T.

description:
Tiny shop but with such an amazing variety of high quality choux pastry.  

Let's get the ugly out of the way - $2.50 per pastry.  They sell them by the half dozen or the dozen but with no scaling discount.  It is $2.50 per tiny pastry no matter how much you buy.  I guess your discount is the box?

But once you get that out of the way you are left with a ton of creativity with beautifully decorated artisanal choux pastry.  Usually when they are that pretty they suffer on taste but these were soft and creamy with just the right of sweetness.  Each flavor shone brilliantly and was highly distinguishable.

Makes a perfect gift for your significant other.  Gents - I know we just passed Valentines Day but if you actually missed Valentines Day this might be a great strategy to get back into her good graces.
author: Tarek S.

description: It's the first time I tasted a Choux pastry and I really liked it. The pastry is crispy and not too sweet which contains a creamy filling. I particularly like the custard one.
author: Tejashree M.

description:
Adorned by clean white tiled walls, mint green hanging light fixtures, and a black and white map on the ceiling, Choux Bakery brings a modern, yet charming appeal to the Lower Haight neighborhood. The two small wooden chairs and a large easel propping up drawing paper with chalk makes this bakery fun and whimsical.

A few friends and I stopped by Choux Bakery shortly before opening. The pastry chef, Sara, was very sweet and friendly as we chatted a bit while she was setting up the counter display of miniature choux cream puffs. Turns out, she's a foodstagrammer herself so taking photos of the adorably-decorated choux cream puffs was not frowned upon.

Each choux cream puff is small, about the size of a golf ball, and expensive for $2.50 a piece. Several flavors are regulars (eg: vanilla, chocolate, pistachio), but there are two additional flavors that change monthly (eg: cookies & cream, coconut & yuzu). The pastry puffs are soft, chewy and airy, and bursting with flavorful fillings, each very distinct in flavor.

Aside from choux puffs, Choux Bakery also sells meringues, mason jar filled salted caramel sauce, and coffee. Chounuts are available at noon and sell out around 3pm. I'm a sucker for cute desserts, so I'll pay Choux Bakery another visit if I'm in the neighborhood.
author: Priscilla W.

description:
Yes I ate more than half a dozen of choux and yes it was probably almost 20 dollars and yesI have no regrets. Choux and cream puffs are similar, but choux are more lighter and airy than your regular cream puffs. 

For 2.50 a piece, these cute little choux are a small bite YET not over indulgent or too much like other desserts! What sets this apart from other French or choux bakeries is the unique flavor palettes. The pistachio, lemon, and strawberry are super flavorful - and the cream isn't too heavy. Personally, the other flavors are good, but nothing life changing. The cute decorations and fondant on top also give their desserts quite a charm! 

I would definitely suggest buying a choux box for a group of friends or as a present, but would not suggest eating a whole box to yourself like what I did. These things can get addicting when you keep telling yourself just one more!
author: Eric Joseph D.

description:
My coworker ordered these for my birthday and they are incredible. The choux pastry is light and airy while the creme patissiere is smooth and velvety. The flavors we got (chocolate and Tahitian vanilla) were on point. They were not overly sweet and the quality of the ingredients really shone through. Best of all, the decorations were appealing and squeal-worthy.

I had a peek at their website and I am anxious to try the pistachio cream puff, lemon cream puff and chounut. This place is definitely worth a try!
author: Joan S.

description:
$2.50 per cream puff & $3 something for the cream puff/donut- WORTH IT, it goes by half a dozen OR dozen but regardless of how much you get it's still $2.50

I tried the Matcha raspberry donut & it's so yummy, I wish I bought more!

(Pronounciation is  ; "SHOE") haha
author: Precious C.

description:
Laura is the inventor of the Chounut (choux and doughnut). Just like a cream puff but shaped as a doughnut. Absolutely delicious..

My favourite was the Rose Strawberry Meringue. The aromatic floral smell and fruity taste combined together was just amazing. Another baked good that I love is the Chounut..
author: Jenny D.

description: Beautiful pastries! They make a perfect birthday present which is what I bought them for. The cashier who rang me up was very friendly and I appreciated her kindness.
author: Lauren G.

description: I randomly came across this little bakery and decided to check it out. It's a tiny little shop with a variety of cream puffs. Each one is named after a real person that the owner knows and the flavors are based off their personality. I thought that was so neat and cute! For $2.50 each, these little cream puffs are pretty pricey. But the presentation is so beautiful and cute. We bought a box of six ($15), which came in a nice box as well --great for gifts. Some of these were a bit too sweet for me. Overall, the flavors were okay.
author: Cindy Z.

description: I was super excited to try their cute choux puffs but they when I tried a few, they had lost the light airy fluff that choux should have and had become moist and soft.
author: Miki O.

description: My boyfriend and I tried out this place last night, so good! Much better than beard papas. Wanted to take pics, but ate them too quickly. Highly recommend. Best flavors: The hazelnut, chocolate+ passion fruit (seasonal), and Pistachio. Vanilla was alright, nothing to write home about.
author: Isha S.

description:
Get the banana nutella choukie ($4), super yummy and more bang for your buck. 

The choux are pretty tiny. As delicious as they were, $11 for four of them seem like a pretty steep price. But I do like how petite they were, just enough to taste and satisfy. 

Bummed they were out of the hazelnut, but the coffee and pistachio were good.
author: Christine Y.

description: Pretty good cream puffs and cute looking too. Great for instagram pictures but expensive and a lot smaller than most pictures will make you think. I went around 3pm and they only had 2 cream puffs to choose for maybe 7 flavors. Everything was sold out and they didn't make an effort to put out more. 8 puffs for $21 and 1 donut is $6.
author: Cornelia C.

description:
We were gifted cream puffs at work on Wednesday, December 9th from Choux Bakery. Wanting an afternoon sweet treat, I decided to try one.

There were only two left, so I randomly picked the Sunny: lemon curd and meringue. The puff was flaky and crispy while the filling was velvety and creamy with a subtle tartness. So good! I would have had another one, but these are so decadent, one was enough to fulfill my sweet craving. Plus, I didn't want to be the greedy fat a$$ that ate two cream puffs!

I know a lot of people say the puffs are expensive, but since I didn't pay for them, I'm judging purely on taste. And that was heavenly.
author: Elena N.

description:
When I read that these cream puffs were tiny, I didn't expect them to be THAT tiny. I walked in, and while I did find them undeniably adorable in all of there mini-sized beautifully presented glory... I was honestly taken aback as to how small they were. To top it off, they're $2.50 for one! 

The cream puffs were delicious, though! We got the vanilla, pistachio, hazelnut, and salted caramel. My favorites were probably hazelnut and salted caramel! The cream inside all of them were very flavorful, creamy (ha..), and had just the perfect amount of sweetness. I do wish the pastry itself was more buttery and flakey.. I felt the texture was quite lackluster. 

My favorite of all that I've tried would have to be the "chounut"! Kind of like an eclair..  kind of like a jumbo sized cream puff... shaped like a donut haha. There were only 4 when I came in (and I noticed some were noticeably bigger than others... hopefully consistency can be improved for the future!). I tried the strawberry/raspberry (?) one, and inside had both custard and strawberry cream... delicious! This was $4.50... 

Personally, prices are a little steep for what it is. I wouldn't repurchase for myself... maybe a gift or for a special occasion since the presentation and looks of everything are indeed beautiful!
author: Kris C.

description:
They can imitate you
But they can't duplicate you
'Cause you got something special
That makes me wanna taste you
I want it all day long
I'm addicted like it's wrong

It's a shame these little bad boys are so goddamn expensive though...

I thoroughly appreciate how subtly crisp the top of the baked, flaky pastry dough is. For their petite size, the amount of delicate custard filling is ideal. Each one is beautifully garnished symmetrically shaped, and prepared with high-quality ingredients. Biting into one of these French cream puffs is...pure BLISS. 

My favorite flavors: 
+ Paul ( vanilla custard) 
+ Rachel (pistachio custard) 
+ Ben (salted caramel) 
+ Perry ( hazelnut custard, milk chocolate) 

Wonderful gift idea and they do catering for special events! Priced at $2.50 each, you'll have to slowly enjoy each tiny bite.
author: Merica S.

description:
Cute pastry shop

Visited this place multiple times

I always usually get a box of six creampuffs and occasionally a choux-nut.

All the pastries are yummy and not too sweet. Decorations on them are also very cute depending on the season.

Only downside is that they are so pricey. A box of six is around $16 and a choux-nut is $3 a pop.
author: Michele G.

description:
Overall it's a great dessert shop! But since I am a poor student I value quantity as well as the quality of the food. The cream puffs are literally bite-sized and I was a bit disappointed by how small they are and how quickly I devoured them. *tears* 

Pros:
- everything just looks so CUTE. Probably because they are mini: the shop is mini (no seating area, and max of 6 people in the shop at a time), the cream puffs are mini (you can eat it in one bite), and even the decorations are super mini
- very friendly server who will try her hardest to persuade you to buy more than you think you can afford
- freshly baked pastry! You can see the bakers working hard behind the counter 

Cons: 
- pricey; $2.50 per bite-sized cream puff can't satisfy sweet tooth like mine
- flavor is average. I tried Sophie (with dark chocolate filling) and it didn't taste too special to me. Maybe I should have tried another flavor that's more unique (like lemon tart, or pistachio)
- no seating area so you will have to resist the urge of eating them right away (or shamelessly eat it on the street like we did)
author: Wendy F.

description: I sent my boyfriend the GF/DF box of brownies and he loved them!  A huge thank you to the sweet lady who wrote the congrats card for my gift tonight! Since my nickname is "kitten" she drew an adorable kitty at the bottom of the card! So cute:) Thank you sooo much!
author: Sdkitty 3.

description: Great treats! They have a gluten free choux-nut (I believe that's the name) that is delicious. It has a great filling and is better than a donut but a bit pricey.
author: Mary K.

description: A coworker brought in an assortment of the cream puffs from Choux and they are absolutely delicious. Very fresh ingredients and just the right amount of sweet. These are definitely a specialty item as they are quite pricey but for a special occasion they're definitely worth it
author: Andreea M.

description:
LOVEEEEE THIS TINY BAKERY. I wish I lived in SF so I could come here at least once a week. ;( The bf and I just happened to be walking by and I couldn't help myself but come in. The sign outdoors mentioned cream puffs (LOVEEE CREAM PUFFS).

We got the raspberry, lemon, and matcha creams puffs, as well as, their Chounut. Their cream puffs were delectable. It was filled with real cream filling instead of the bs whipped cream crap like some places do (f the ish). Back to the chonut. YOU MUST GET THE CHOUNUT. YOU MUST!!!!!! (I have never heard of this dessert or seen anything close, a distant cousin of the cronut from Ansel perhaps tho tastes nothing like it). Anywho, I don't even like donuts especially donuts with filling inside and the Chounut blew my socks off. There was a raspberry filling on one side, and the other side had I think a normal cream filling. I almost wanted to buy another one right after. Just go and get it, drooling as I type. So damn sad they don't have one of these in LA.....
author: Shyann C.

description:
Fantastic quality French puffs!
We have ordered them for a private event and they were gone very quickly...that is how good they are!
Super tasty (not too sweet) and visually highly esthetic. French bakery at its best.
I highly recommend this place!
author: C C.

description:
Ordered on Postmates and came quickly in a beautiful box! You can call and ask for the seasonal flavors and write in the notes for them to replace it with the seasonal - they will do it for you in store. 

Each one is $2.50, and they're a decent size (a little bigger than a golf ball). I'm sure most people think of beard papa's huge puffs but this is a much more refined choux with a beautiful cream to puff ratio.. not to mention these are freaking gorgeous. 

-Earl grey (seasonal as of Sep'16): 4/5 subtle tea flavors, but still strong enough to say "wow, that's earl grey." 
-Deborah (berry): 3/5 I was not expecting such a strong berry flavor!! But it is really really good. It tastes like the berry freezes @ Costco.. It isn't a very mellowed out creamy berry - it's a strong, tart one. I'm not quite sure if it fits well with the cream puff pastry. 
-Rachel (pistachio): 4/5 strong pistachio flavor. 
-Paul (vanilla): 5/5 the most ammmaazing vanilla with specks of vanilla bean. really amazing. 
-Sophie (chocolate): 5/5 really good, not too rich.
author: Shelley K.

description: This place is cute. The cream puffs are bomb! I got a mixture for my coworkers since they were having a bad day. Everyone loved them. All the flavors were very good and too sweet at all. Wish they were a little bigger. Highly recommended this place!!
author: Nini B.

description: I'm addicted to Choux. At least once a month (if not more), I order it from Postmates. The chouxnut is awesome. If they have the one with the caramel popcorn on top, you have to try it. Everything is as delicious as it is adorable, so I highly recommend collecting them all.
author: Erica K.

description:
We found this place from UberEATS. I love everything made by passion fruits so I decided to give this place a try, 

Their Passion Fruits meringues is crispy on the outside, and it dissolves slowly in the mouth with light fruity scent. It would be awesome to watch a Korean drama and eating these on side \(^_^)/

We also tried their seasonal cream puffs: there was cream cheese on top of the cream puff , it taste rich and creamy. The size of this cream puff is around 1", pretty tiny but it works for one bite.

The Chonuts is amazingly delicious, but it's smaller than a standard donut (The size is more like the Japanese style donuts). We tried their seasonal Chonuts, but I couldn't tell what are the ingredients exactly ( it tasted like a combination of almond paste, sesame, pumpkin spice or cinnamon? ) 

they change their Chonut flavors every week. I am curious with other flavors. 

It was a fun tasting on a Saturday!
author: Karen C.

description:
My 8 year old son and I are so crazy about the cream puff at Choux. They have so nice variety with the different flavor, My favorite one is matcha green tea.  Not super sweet, the taste is just right. 
The puff is not too thick which is nice and smooth flavor with the creamery inside, just feel like it can melt in my mouth!!
Highly recommended if you are looking for some unique flavor cream puff .
Laura is a real Parisian girl so can't go wrong with the original!
author: cathaleeya K.

description:
These are the cutest little cream puffs I have ever seen! Absolutely adorable and so pretty to look at. Each one is $2.50, and it's about the size of a half dollar coin. Quite tiny...

The smallest box size comes at 6 for $15. I can eat that up in a minute! :( Because I didn't want to spend too much, I decided to get 2, which came in a small bag. I decided to order the Perry (hazelnut) and the Paul (vanilla) for the smiley face. I love custard. I found this to be not too overwhelmingly sweet and very creamy. 

The service was very friendly. When I got there, there was a bit of a line on a Saturday afternoon. More than half of the items on the display were already gone, but the cashier reassured us that they were being made in the oven in the back and any of the flavors could still be ordered. 

I would say these are a bit too hefty for the small size. But they are really nice to look at, and I would get them as a gift.
author: Christina G.

description: the cookies are really overpriced. The are tiny and much much smaller than we expected. I ordered some for delivery and they replaced one of our orders with a different type without confirming with us. Overall, not a good experience compared to the high price we paid for it.
author: Reza F.

description: The lemon one is the most flavorful & refreshing. I didn't the salted caramel and hazelnut mainly cause of the dull flavor.
author: Wildeflower M.

description: I actually ate lunch across the way at the ramen shop and saw a donut picture in the window.  That is what originally drew me over.  After lunch we stopped in and I got a box of 6 for $15.  The cream puffs are on the small side for $2.50 a pop, but you are paying for quality and the flavors were unlike any other cream puff spot I've been to.  I passed on the donut because the flavor of the day was passion fruit.  No passion or love from me there.  So I decided to pick up a handful of puffs instead.  First, they are adorable.  I didn't want to eat them because they were so cute.  One of them had a little cloud face!  Each had a human name, which actually kinda weirded me out.  Because, I'm eating Ben... But they were delicious no matter what they were named.  What's in a name, a cream puff by any other name would still  taste as sweet.  I loved the lemon and vanilla.  The raspberry was also good.  We got a few chocolate ones as well, but chocolate isn't really my thing.
author: Anjelica C.

description: This place was a lot smaller than I thought, really cute! The presentation is just adorable and they have a good selection of little choux puffs that each have their own names. It is a bit expensive, 2.5 a puff, but it is San Francisco. I do prefer cream puffs with cream inside rather than a custard but it is yummy. Give them a try if you're in the area!
author: Larissa L.

description: Show up early in the day, they sell out fast!!! the choux are really great but I feel the fillings could have stronger flavor. It's really clear on the Valrhona chocolate choux where I expected the strong iconic flavor of Valrhona chocolate but it was just a bit too light. The sweetness of the choux is just right, not too sweet. I strongly recommend!
author: Thomas L.

description:
I Choux you for my dessert!

Teeny bites of deliciousness. Just the right amount of sweet indulgence without making me feel overly guilty when I submit my food log to my trainer.

Also, it is just around the corner from my fave brunch spot (Maven) and boutique (Wildflower). It's fun to stroll down to Lower Haight on the weekends to make my usual rounds and pick up a box of these treats. Only about half will actually make it home though since I have zero self control around sugar. 

My faves are the Sunny (lemon curd!) and the Tahitian vanilla. I'm hit or miss on the matcha green tea. Some days they're fantastic and other days I feel like they are either too light or not sweet enough. I can't wait for the pumpkin spice ones to return in the fall!
author: Elizabeth T.

description: Bought 36 cream puffs on the first day and to all men out there if you have a woman who loves sweets you will get these amazing cream puffs for her. Staff was hilarious and friendly as well as informative. They're like macaroons but for cream puffs. They have seasonal flavors and I can't wait to come back to this place again because it was a life saver for me. My favorite is the chocolate. Cute lil shop and was worth every penny!
author: Oscar L.

description:
After having lunch at Memphis Minnie's down the block while waiting for my bus I found myself eyeing the sweets in the display at Choux. They mainly offer french cream puffs, which seem to be smaller and less messy than normal cream puffs. In addition they have something called Chouxnuts and a handful of meringue bags. 

These desserts were enjoyable. The outside was a bit more bread like than flaky. I'm not sure if that's what makes it a french cream puff but I think I prefer the flaky style. Either way, these were way too expensive to get again. 

Overall, I wasn't overly impressed with this place and even less so considering the exorbitant cost. Factoring that in I definitely have to say that "I've experienced better."
author: Mark O.

description: Cute little cream puff place. Right size and not too filling like say Beard Papas. I tried the pistachio
author: Ernest M.

description: I've had cream puffs before but these petite choux blew me away! I ordered 3 flavors for an event I was having at work and they were a hit. Tiny bites but amazing flavor. I love that it's a thin crispy layer on the outside and the custard fills up the whole puff. There's definitely no air pockets here. The custard itself is flavorful and on point! Catering was a breeze - place an order online and it was delivered via Uber eats.
author: Lisa L.

description:
I arrived at Choux Bakery about 10 minutes before it opened, because I didn't know how popular it would be.  Choux Bakery is in a relatively nice neighborhood, with ample street parking and a bunch of other small restaurants along the street.  The bakery itself is very small, the definition of a hole in the wall, with two small chairs up front and no seating inside.  It appeared that one woman was working there, and baked the choux herself, and she was laying out the cream puffs in the case in the few minutes before the bakery opened.

I purchased a box of 6 of the cream puffs, selecting 6 different flavors.  I thought it was cute that each flavor had a human name associated with it.  For example, the Valrhona chocolate custard and dark chocolate cream puff is named "Sophie."  It was fun to select Sophie, Paul, Rachel, Perry, Lara, and Elsa as the flavors for my cream puffs.  The "Rachel" cream puff was a pistachio custard cream puff with a fondant flower on top, and the pistachio flavor was excellent.

I also purchased a passion fruit dark chocolate chouxnut, which is shaped like a donut, but made out of choux and filled with passion fruit and chocolate cream topped with Valrhona crunchy pearls.  The passion fruit cream had a really fruity and vibrant and after eating it, my friend and I decided to purchase another one.  The lady working there told us the chouxnut is actually gluten free, but they don't like to advertise that because people might think it doesn't taste good if it's gluten free.  The chouxnut was great and I highly recommend it!

Overall, quaint little spot and I would definitely return.
author: Melody L.

description:
3.75

Almost too cute to eat but I like eating cute things. I'm not a fan of desserts with filling but these tiny pastries had the right amount.  Not only was it the right amount, but the flavors were good too.

We tried 3 different kinds each with a different filling.  The pastries have actual names but I can't recall what we ordered.  All I know is, out of the three, the Deborah? with the raspberry filling was the best.  Other than that, it's nothing special.
author: Linda N.

description:
This place is the cutest!!! But I'm rating it a three star - because as all the other reviews say, the cream puffs are tiny AND its super pricey for the size ($2.50 a pop) - though delicious but they disappear in seconds :(. 

The cream puffs are a great gift for others though - given their bite sized cuteness and perfect designs. I got two boxes of 6, at $15 each. I asked the server on duty what she recommended and she basically recommended everything. I got to try the honey lavender, vanilla, chocolate, hazelnut, green tea/matcha, pistachio, and lemon. I think all of them tasted great but my favorite was the green tea/matcha one. You bite into each of these and there's a large amount of custard right in the middle. Ugh, so good. But I wish you made them in larger sizes. I'm allergic (a-CHOUX) to the small sizes and high prices! 

I probably won't come again but I'd love to get some as a gift ;)
author: Annie L.

description: I came in with the misunderstanding from my partner that this was a cupcake shop but was pleasantly surprised to find they sold cream puffs. Much more my style, as I find cupcakes to be too sweet. Each cream puff is adorably decorated and named after someone the owner knows in real life, which only makes it cuter. We bought a box of six: Ben, Paul, Perry, Nataly, Sunny, and Rachel. They were all delicious. Ben (salted caramel custard) was my absolute favourite, but you really have to get an assortment. They're too good to only get one.
author: Elliott F.

description:
Yummy! Best cream puffs I've ever had, for sure! They are small (2-bite size) and make a great item to bring to a potluck or party, or even to give as a gift. I believe 6 puffs were about $13, and the box is super cute too. All the flavors I tried were good, and not too sweet, and not too creamy (I usually don't like cream puffs because it's like you're just eating a dollop of whipped cream - not my cup of tea, personally). These little guys are nicely balanced in flavor and texture.

Bonus, we got a free sample of their cream-less puffs so my sister was able to enjoy a lactose-free treat as well!
author: Kathy L.

description:
Date & Time:  Friday August 29, 2014 @ 11:30am
Scene:  Girls in Fitted Tops Tucked into Skinny Jeans, Hermes Belt + Nude Flats & Guys in Pastel Checkered Shirts, Jeans + Loafers
Decor:  Charming French Bakery.  Black & White Photos, Subway Tiles & Carrera Marble 
Service:  Sweet Proprietor & Dapper Frenchman 
Devour:  French Cream Puffs in Vanilla, Pistachio, Raspberry, Caramel, Coffee, Hazelnut, PassionFruit, Rum, Chocolate, Mint Chocolate, Lemon Custard  
Cute Blue & Brown Boxes for 6,12, 24 Cream Puffs Priced at $13, $27, $55
Total:  $27
author: Genevieve Y.

description: This cute little neighborhood bakery has some of the best cream puffs in town. They are European inspired. Not too sweet but just right - it hits the spot. Love the vibes of this place and the friendly service.
author: Jonas G.

description:
Bakery!!! Cream puff!  So so so yummy.  Brand new bake shop specializing in adorable, beautiful, cream puffs that actually taste as good as they look. (I think we've all been there right? Where the deserts look great, but they are kind of disappointing in taste)

My favorite was the mint chocolate!!
author: Chloe M.

description: What a sweet delight! Seriously, if you haven't tried Choux's cream puff than you are missing out. I found this place while searching for cronuts and came across this sweet little boutique. FYI, this place is right next door to three twin sisters ice cream store- on FILLMORE & HAIGHT. With their latest creations, I had to try their pumpkin chai. [AS an EXTREME PUMPKIN LOVER] they surely nailed the flavors- the mini treat were fluffy, and airy that melts away in your mouth. I am truly a new fan of Choux.
author: Teresa C.

description:
This itty bitty little shop + it's dainty little French cream puffs are about as adorable as your neighbor's froofy little dog, as the cheeks of a baby, as group of waddling ducklings. And in case you haven't seen their Instagram yet (https://instagram.com/chouxsf/), it's like something out of a magazine. So very Pintrest-worthy. But I digress. The point is, this is the type of place you go to get a sweet treat for your girlfriend//girl-you-wish-would-be-your-girlfriend/mom/grandma/friend in the hospital/birthday/etc. These pretty little treats are unique gifts + definite crowd pleasers. 

I first had the honor of tasting some of these bitty beauties when my office ordered a whole bunch of them for a colleague's birthday http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/choux-bakery-san-francisco-2?select=pXldM8SE3fUTtNFQYTDyug. One bite + it was gone... but I was hooked. And had to have another one. I made my first visit to the shop not even a week later to see the full selection of cream puffs for myself + ended up ordering a box of 6 to take home to share with my family http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/choux-bakery-san-francisco-2?select=R_9_LV72CLdW2dkAzWgVBA. I swear I initially just planned on just getting 2-3, but I couldn't help it. There were just too many flavors that looked good. This trip resulted in getting a S'mores (seasonal!), Lemon Curd, Irish Coffee (seasonal!), Coffee Custard, Valhrona (seasonal!) Chocolate, + Salted Caramel. All were quite delectable, but the Salted Caramel + Irish Coffee were definitely the winners. 

On a second visit, the first one to catch my eye was the Rum Custard. Who wouldn't be intrigued by rum in a cream puff?!? The next obvious choice for me was getting the Salted Caramel again, + I ended up rounding out the box with a Mocha (seasonal!), Cookies n Cream + Hazelnut. http://www.yelp.com/user_local_photos?select=o7Y8dMLJ4gAyhAhRwIXkkA&userid=6YEnpx-qloIfFX-L9uyfbQ The Rum Custard unfortunately didn't make it into the photo because it was devoured before I remembered to snap a pic. Oops. But trust me, it's worth a try for being unique. As mentioned, they feature seasonal flavors based on holidays + often make the decor on top even prettier for these flavors, which again makes this even more of a gift-worthy stop. 

Priced at $2.50 a piece, these babies aren't cheap, but neither is the presentation of the product. I'd rather spend $15 purchasing a prettily packaged box of pretty puffs from a local business than a generic box of Godiva any day. And if you're looking for a cute date idea, take your significant other here + then trek a few blocks over to Alamo Square Park with a blanket in tow. 

You're welcome.
author: Janelle Q.

description:
Bonjour~. Just like that it's like you've walked into Paris. This tiny boutique houses the most wonderful little cream puffs ever. And when I say little - I mean itty bitty maybe 1.5 inches in diameter. But regardless these are the most delicious little cream puffs I've ever tasted. The perfect crunch as you bite through the shell, the slow ooze of the custard filling. Then the soft sigh of satisfaction after finishing that bite mm. 

I was only able to try out two flavors as each one is 2.50 a bit steep for my taste. We asked for recommendations and ended up trying the salted caramel and hazelnut. 

You. MUST. get the salted caramel. It is not an option. It was so delicious - I was amazed. After trying it the hazelnut just couldn't live up to those expectations sigh~. But they were both wonderful.
author: Rita Y.

description: Stumbled upon this cute French bakery by happenstance. The lemon, pistachio and salted caramel cream puffs were divine. A perfect crispy outside and a silky, not-too-sweet creamy filling. I'm certainly making this a regular stop whenever I'm in the Haight.
author: Kassie B.

description: This is a one-of-a-kind dessert. Choux treats are becoming the new "it" dessert of the San Francisco. The puffs are delicious, with quality ingredients, creative flavors and overall YUM. Just tried the lavender puff and it was out-of-this-world. If you have a sweet tooth, Choux is the place to go!
author: Talia R.

description: So cute. Perfect for bringing to a party. The flavors weren't as exciting as I hoped but I would still come back for the cute factor.
author: Jen K.

description: The raspberry chocolate was pretty good. If you are looking for anything other than the classic choux pastry, don't go. It's good but it won't leave you craving more!
author: Simone F.

description: Walked by today, my boyfriend went in to get a coffee, we found out everything looks sooooo good while waiting so we decided to buy 2 to try, we finished the 2 in the car and I ran back to buy more, they are amazingly good! Not too sweet like most places, it's just perfect for me! I will definitely come back!!
author: Lulu W.

description: This is my FAV bakery!! Really delicious, amazing customer service with really friendly people! Also - they have chouxnuts that are deeelicious! Love this a lot
author: Aliza M.

description: While riding the 22 bus, it drove past this place. I saw the words "cream puff" and immediately got off the bus to go. The workers were super friendly. I got the Lamia, which was cheesecake inspired. So delicious! I can't wait to go back and try more of the other flavors.
author: Allyson L.

description: So good! I bought a six pack of puffs to share. Next time I'll get six for my-greedy-self and six to share. Exquisite presentation, beautiful to look at, delicious creams and a slight crisp to the outside.  Very well done. I'll be back the next time I'm in town.
author: Marina G.

description:
I'm French and these choux are amazingly good!! Try the lemon and speculos one, delicious!

Everything is cute in the store
author: Margaux M.

description: Cute and delicious?!? What else can you ask for?! I wish they came in a bigger size because I inhale these suckers! This are like cream puffs but these have a more equal shell to cream filling. The chonuts are amazing as well.  Try everything you won't regret it! A little pricey but well worth it in my book.
author: Whitney N.

description:
To surprise my boyfriend for his birthday I got him chouquettes for breakfast.
Being French, we can be picky about our pastries. And those were amazing, even the day after I bought them! They are smaller than what I am used to and relatively pricey, but this is San Francisco and we are talking about French pastries.
Also they come in the cutest bags :) Now I want to try more of their choux!
author: Coralie S.

description:
I finally got the chance to try Choux.. and it did not disappoint!! I came here with my parents earlier this week and we got a few chouxs to share. My favorite was the one with milk chocolate and hazelnut-- so good! Yes they are small but this is a traditional FRENCH cream puff... they are supposed to be this small!! I have had many cream puffs in my visits to France and Choux is absolutely the real deal!! :)

I really enjoyed chatting with the owner.. she was really sweet and passionate about what she does! Love this place :)
author: Jaime M.

description: The desserts here are so delicious. We had the lemon choux and the pistachio choux and both were yummy. The people who work here are so friendly and helpful.
author: R L.

description:
Uh huh!  It's my sh*t!  

The creampuff making a name as the new "it" dessert of San Francisco, and Choux owner is leading the way.  This charming little gem in the heart of the Lower Haight brings a bite-sized piece of Paris to San Francisco.

Love how cute, quaint and cozy it feels once you walk inside.  Now keep in mind, this isn't really a sit-down bakery.  It's so tiny and you may be able to sit at the one chair they have inside. But that doesn't even matter because you'll be thoroughly charmed with the decor (don't forget to look up at the ceiling!), and you'll be walking away with itty-bitty pieces of heaven :)

Each creampuff has its own name (like Paul, Rachel, etc) and it's own super-cute style. A box of six will knock the pants off of anyone. You can totally bring them to the office, gift to a friend or walk away with a bag for yourself :)  Either way, whomever gets to eat them will feel nothing but pure joy and happiness!

Cupcakes, move over!  It's all about the creampuff!
author: Angella S.

description:
My friend and I walked by Choux Bakery after having brunch at Cafe du Soleil. We were drawn in by the visual appeal of the cream puffs. Actually we didn't realize they were cream puffs until we ordered some. They're so cute and colorful! You really feel welcome and at home through the bakery decor and warmth of service. There is plenty of variety to choose from so as not to be overwhelming... and there are seasonal flavors!

We ordered half a dozen cream puffs for around $14. Our flavors included lemon, chocolate, hazelnut, rum, and apple. The rum and hazelnut cream puffs were definitely my favorite, and I love how small they are so you can really sample and savor multiple flavors. I feel like many people walk by Choux and wonder how good it is, and I'm telling you... it's worth satisfying your curiosity!
author: Stefanie C.

description:
I was very excited to try this neighborhood spot. Pulled up right in front and sent my kids in with some money. They returned shortly with a lovely packaged box of 6 choux - they opened the box to show me what they picked and noticed that the salesperson gave them the wrong flavors. They hopped back into the shop to tell them about the mistake. The counter servers admitted their error, but after some discussion, sent the kids away with the incorrect order, claiming there was nothing they could do because of sanitation issues. Hm. How about giving them the correct flavors and sending happy customers on their way? I guess at $2.50 a petit pop, they have to watch their waste, but this service was surprisingly small-minded.

The choux themselves were tasty and well presented, but the experience left a bad taste in our mouths. Not going back.
author: Diana H.

description:
Choux (pronounced shoe) was such an amazing tiny pastry store. The decor is like stepping into Paris in her small space and the delicate cream puffs are not only gorgeous, but delicious. 

I am a sucker for salted caramel so as I was waiting for my bus I stepped in and couldn't resist. I had the Ben which was salted caramel, milk chocolate, and caramel custard. It was like a small explosion of greatness with the first bite, and the next. So creamy with the custard and the salted caramel was on point. 

My highlight of my trip to The Haight for sure!
author: Leslie D.

description:
I'm not sure what the big fuss was - maybe I just had a bad batch?

From the reviews, I understood they would be tiny. Like $1 coin tiny and for $2.50 per puff, I assumed they were going to literally knock my socks off. 

Yes, they were adorable and looked perfect in their perfect wrapping but at the end of the day, my puff was hard, the cream on the inside was too sweet and the little frosting on top was so hard it was pointless to eat. 

Maybe I am just used to westernized cream puffs and the Bearded Papa's of today. I won't be back :(
author: Leina K.

description: Great French bakery! The pastries were delicious (I particularly enjoyed the pistacho one) and their hazelnut cappuccino was very good. The owner was super friendly and had an amazing story to tell about her journey to start this shop.
author: Andres T.

description:
Dropped by during lunch this afternoon. Cute store!  Received a warm welcome from Laura (the owner) when I entered store. It is my first time here and she asked how I heard about the bakery and a few friendly conversation questions. She is so nice and friendly. I was somewhat in a hurry so I didn't start any long conversation with her.

I decided to get one dozen Cream puffs, a few Chonut and Mini Meringues to share with family. Laura was so kind and explained to me the cream puff flavor of the one without a sign. She also told me they were making more DAVID (S'mores) and coming out shortly.  

These cream puffs are amazing. Yes, it's bite size and a little expensive but I think it's worth the price (keep in mind, macarons are just similar in price). They have very cute name and design for each cream puff flavor. The creativity and of course the taste wins it all.  I bought LEA (Matcha), DAVID (S'mores), SUNNY (Lemon Curd), PERRY (Hazelnut), PAUL (Vanilla), SOPHIE (Chocolate), EMILIE (Rum/Caramel), RACHEL (Pistachio) and Ben (Salted Caramel).

Chonut is also great! I had the strawberry chonut. Again, very cute design and amazing strawberry filling. I love this better than cronut because these are baked to perfection. Cronuts from other bakeries are good but kind of oily.

Mini Meringues
Rose is my favorite. Perfection of sweetness and rose flavor.
Strawberry Basil also very delicious. I was surprised with the basil flavor mixed with strawberry. Very unique!

Choquette is like a no filling puff with sprinkled sugar. It's quite good. These are so much better than donut holes. 

Only street parking in this area. I was lucky to find parking nearby. 

Would come again to try more cream puff flavors and other treats. Grab the seasonal flavors before it's gone!  I would suggest visiting their website or call them if you want to know their cream puff flavors and availability.

**They offer stamp card.  Buy 24 cream puffs and get a free gift!**
author: Kei C.

description:
X did not quite mark the spot for me. Strangely enough, these bite-size morsels reminded me of Honey Berry's Roti buns. Now, Roti bun lovers, don't get me wrong because I do love Roti buns, but if I wanted a Roti Bun I would have gone to Honey Boo-boo.
I'm not sure if this is the true sense of a french cream puff, maybe, I'm used to the westernized version of a cream puff, however the size reminded me of a macaroon. Confused? me too.  But this one did not make me "oooh la la" the way Pacific Puff does. I thought the variety of creams and "topping" were very cute.  They were good  but sadly not good enough to go back for $2.50 a pop.  I even entertained the thought of these cuties being overly done due to the brownness and extra crispness of the choux but the entire batch looked that way so maybe that's the way it's supposed to be.  I'm no baker for sure but I'm sure one tell of a taster.
author: Michelle B.

description:
A tiny but lovely puff pastry shop beside Three Twins along Fillmore and Haight. 

Their cream puffs are heavenly light with a wide selection of flavors. I can't recall the names of the their tiny beauties but I've never been disappointed so far.
author: Gordon O.

description:
Choux Bakery is a cute little store. They had about 15 or so options of cream puffs all ranging from fruity flavors to chocolate and vanilla. 

I ordered 6 for $15 and a chocolate chonut! Each cream puff was about $2.50, expensive little suckers. The yelp photos made them look a lot bigger. They are actually small and bite sized, like others said, about the size of a macaroon. 

First, the cream puffs look beautiful. They kind of look like cupcakes from an aerial view and that's what I thought they were when I saw photos of them initially. They taste pretty good, nothing mind blowing. The texture of the outer parts was a bit crunchy. The filling wasn't too sweet and each cream puff had a different topping which gave the some of the cream puffs a nice crunch. We ordered the chocolate custard, green tea, rum custard, pistachio, salted caramel, and coffee. I think my favorite was green tea. I just love green tea everything though, so theres a bias. 

The Chonut tasted like a Eclair, but with a crunch. It was pretty good. 

Overall, I probably wouldn't get my creampuff fix here for myself because I think it's a bit too expensive for the size, but if you are buying for somebody else or for a special occasion then I think it's worth it because they are pretty cream puffs.
author: Allen C.

description:
How can you beat that? 

Went to choux a dozen of times since I'm in SF, this place is amazing. You don't get bored because these choux are amazing
author: Matt H.

description:
Choux.

Super adorbs.

Super small.

Super expensive.

Welcome to San Francisco, the most expensive city in the US to travel to and the second most expensive city to live in! Now watch out for that Eiffel tower of poop!!!

OTHER NOTES:
*Choux Bakery's grand opening was yesterday, two doors down from Three Twins.
*They sell choux: French cream puffs (13 flavors), chouquette: empty cream puffs (2 flavors), hot chocolate, coffee, and tea.
*Prices:
--Choux are $2.75 each
--Chouquettes are 8 for $5
*Only 4 flavors were available when we went so we got 3 choux: pistachio, coconut mint chocolate, and chocolate raspberry: http://bit.ly/YYmtBj.
*They were very expensive and very small (smaller than a golf ball); 1/3rd the size of Beard Papa's and the size of mini Pacific Puffs making them the most expensive and smallest choux in the city. I know it may be an unfair comparison to chains so to give you another example, Sweetmue (The Mission), a boutique bakery sells their asian-inspired choux for $2 each. 
*Pastry shell is firm and sturdy and cream filling is on the denser side (reminded me of cupcake frosting). Beautifully made choux but taste is ordinary. I totally agree with Albertino M.'s review: http://bit.ly/1pcBTqB. 
*Shoebox sized shop with no tables for seating.
*CC's accepted.
author: Cherylynn N.

description:
Cute shop with cute choux (shoo)!
They are cream puffs that have cute designs.
So far my fave one is the ben (salted caramel). I also liked the Earl grey, chocooate marshmallow, cookies and cream and berries & cream.  

There are about twelve flavors and usually none of them disappoint.

The packaging is cute. 
Must go back to try their dipping puffs.
Their meringues are good too.
author: Heejin L.

description:
Choux  Bakery sells French cream puffs @2.75 except they don't use cream as a filler, they use chocolate, fruit flavors, coffee, hazelnut, etc. 

"Choux" cream puffs are smaller than the beef balls i got in pho  in vietnamese eateries.  Size does matter to me. fillings does too. i like the traditional cream, not the fancy fillings.
-Chouquettes (empties): 8/$5.

sorry Choux, 3.5 (small) star. 
-texture of the puffs was nice.

note: a few doors from Twins ice cream.
author: Victor G.

description:
Little bites of goodness!

These little cream puffs are just as tasty as they look. Each one is decorated to perfection whether it is with a coffee bean or fondant flower. The outer layer is crunchy (the texture reminds me of an asian pineapple bun) while the filling is creamy and not too rich. These desserts are more on the expensive side for what you get (bite-sizes), but they can make a nice present for someone special.
author: Crystal M.

description: Small and cute little cream puffs in a lot of different flavors! I liked the chocolate. The raspberry was a bit too sweet.
author: Connie S.

description:
Lara made beautiful cream puffs in 10 different flavors for our son's 2nd birthday party.  They were a hit; everyone loved being able to try a few different flavors, and the size and diversity of flavors made it fun and exciting.  Not to mention, puffs themselves were amazingly delicious.  It's such a different, refreshing change from a huge birthday cake or cupcakes.

Lara herself was wonderfully easy to work with, and seemed to genuinely care how the choux were received at the party
author: Lorin Y.

description:
These cream puffs are so beautiful that they look inedible. Each one looks like a ruby, emerald, diamond, fashionable jewel for the up and coming younger professionals' refined intestinal lining. But they taste buttery, creamy, sweet, like a honeysuckle from a hidden fertile grove on Olympus.

I spent all day eating cream puffs and playing video games and I regret nothing!!!

The people who work at this shop are really nice.

No seating. And $2.75 for a cream puff is a little pricey.
author: Mila K.

description:
Hmmm - totally SF style place. Looks so cute and adorable from outside. 
$15 for six small sweets. I don't know - I find it a little pricy. 
It was my first time; so for $15 I expected something really good. The dough and inside cream is good, but not amazingly delicious - not the type of "definitely coming back for more". 
I brought it to my cousins in law and they weren't impressed either. 
Nothing special, just looks cute.
author: Jenna F.

description:
This place is truly. A warning should be at the front door, because once you enter this will be a place you will never want to leave. 

All of the gourmet French cream puffs are named after a person in the baker's life and they are extremely unique. The level of perfection and quality that these puffs hold is impeccable, and Choux has truly created the new trend. The next "macaron" perhaps, but completely different.

This is not your average cream puff, and everything about Choux screams that. You become a bit wary after seeing the price sign, but after looking at the delicate handiwork and seeing the amount of labor that goes into each and every single cream puff [they make them in shop] makes you realize that you would be willing to pay double for each one. (or at least I would!) The six box deal is great, where it is buy five get one free [$2.80 each] and you get to sample some of their quirky flavors. The selection is pretty vast, enough to get two boxes with a single flavor of each I would say so from what I remember, so I'm mad at myself that I didn't get more.

The flavors are so exquisite and delicate, that for a moment you are swept away in a cream puff dream land where everything is beautiful, delicious, and happy. This is how this place makes me feel. My boyfriend was just as excited as me, while we sat there trying each flavor one by one, trying to get the bigger bite, savoring every single second of the heavenly goodness. The Meyer Lemon and the Mint were the standouts flavor wise, but the PassionFruit with the candy coating and silver star sprinkles was my favorite all around because I have never seen or tried anything like it. 

This place is here to stay, they aren't going anywhere and I expect a few more locations to pop up soon. I am thoroughly impressed and really excited I have a new gourmet munchie spot that's in heavy competition with the macaron in my mind. But, I've got plenty of room in my heart and mind for both. Fantastic find. You'll love it as much as I did I promise.
author: Anna G.

description: This spot is Sooooo DELICIOUS!! They are homemade cream puffs. They make them right in front of you. & they are SOOO Amazing! The cream is not too sweet. They are all filled with different flavored custards. It's a simple SinFul Treat because they are soo delicious you will keep Poppin another one in your mouth till they are all gone.
author: Royal H.

description:
THIS BUSINESS SENDS TEXT SPAM!  We made the mistake of giving them our cell#. WTF don't do that. 

Aside from that, the cream puffs are delicious and adorable.
author: Amy T.

description: Finally made it into this adorable bakery. It's a lot smaller than I thought from the pictures on instagram but totally fell in love with THE PAUL!!! Plus the owner was there and she gave us the story of how she named each cream puff. It's adorable. Her front of the house person was sweet, explained each item and event tried the CHOUXNUT of the month. I swear, these things cream your mouth so much when you bite into them, I'm sure someone out there in the internet will use it in an urban dictionary meme.
author: Sheryl G.

description:
Let's talk about these French cream puffs, because they're absolutely ridiculous.

But wait. This CHONUT tho... whoa, nelly. Now that's beautiful.

So it's a donut. But it's made like a cream puff. And then it's filled with raspberry curd and vanilla custard inside, topped with icing and strawberries on top.

Yah, I know. It's perfection.

But anyways. This is a new bakery in town called Choux (pronouced "shoe"), that specializes in French cream puffs. Once you walk in, you'll find a tiny little space (super cute) that resembles something you'd find straight out of Paris. Guys, the decor is on point.

The owner, Laura is from Nice- she fell in love with SF (who wouldn't?), sold her company in France, packed her bags and here she is today pursing her dreams. (pretty ballzy huh?)

And I'm so glad she did, because these cream puffs are ON POINT. I honestly don't think I've had anything better.

Choux has different flavors like rum custard, pistachio, hazelnut, salted caramel, lemon, and more.

Oh BTW, fellas! These make GREAT surprises & gifts (hint: grab a box for your GF or wifey) 

For more pics and deets, visit: http://cyneats.com/choux-ridiculously-good-french-creme-puffs/
author: Cynthia L.

description: Just ate a gingerbread chouxnut with a double espresso and it was delicious. I'm coming back! And I also will be using choux for presents in the future.
author: David L.

description:
the most adorable cream puffs! 

i found the hazelnut to be tasty! it had a caramelized hazelnut (i could eat these all day long), a disk of dark chocolate, and a really creamy hazelnut mousse/pudding on the inside. mm. the lemon was so tangy and refreshing! but come on, hazelnut hands down.
