they're 2.50/each (and they're pretty tiny, but that's a good thing for my body). it's not a better deal if you get more (you do get a pretty box though). i understand why they're so expensive; they are super time consuming. not necessarily the choux, but definitely the craquelin (the cookie like dough that gets baked into the cream puff that gives it a really nice crunch and makes it look like dutch crunch bread), and all those different fillings and decorations. and the ingredients seemed very high quality (not to mention that hazelnuts are always expensive).

the one thing that i was eh about was the low stock. i went in on a friday afternoon around 2:30, and half of the case was already empty. get here early if you want a nice selection!
author: Heather F.

description: Soooo good esp BEN!!! We went after eating at IZA Ramen which is right accross the street. Its a little pricey for the size of it (almost the size of a dollar coin) but its worth the money $$$
author: JohnVey Rose Dhejan S.

description:
Extra credit to the owner for not facepunching every Yelper who complains about the lack of 'flaky' dough. 
The place is called Choux - it serves Choux pastry. Choux pastry is not flaky. It's light and crispy and the choux at Choux is pretty delicious. Best way to think of these are as little eclairs. ("Cream puffs" clearly makes people think of flakiness.)
Beautiful presentation. A box of these would make a beautiful and impressive gift.
The owner seems super nice (I randomly shared a Lyft Line with her) and I appreciate that she's branching out with other choux-y things like the Chonut. I hope this means we'll see stuff like St. Honoré cakes in the future..?
The only negative for me (nitpicking) -- the names of each flavor. I get that their named after her friends and junk but as a customer, they're totally meaningless and the concept is a bit too twee for my taste.
author: Jennifer L.

description:
This is one of the treasures of San Francisco!

The French cream puffs are authentic, yummy in your mouth, creative, and you can just tell it's made with love and creativity.
Every cream puff is unique on its own, and very tasty--heaven in your mouth!

Besides the amazing, delicious, unique cream puffs that are a win on its own, once you walk into a bakery you walk into a vision and a world that makes you feel like you're in another place-if even for a few minutes. There's a lot of small unique details and everything from the layout, to the boxes all has one vision.

Best of all, the cream puffs are just very delicious and a unique desert like no other.
author: Emilya B.

description:
I have never been a big person on sweets, but with the combination of a super friendly staff and clientele that absolutely love the pastries, they have definitely grown on me. I'm especially a fan of Perry; you can't beat the hazelnut filling. 

I would definitely recommend these delights to any connoisseur of sweets! :)
author: Matt S.

description: Very cute shop with cute cream puffs but man are they tiny! Definitely not worth $2.50 each. The employees will put the hard sell on you to order more. The smallest amount you can order to get a box is 6 ($15!!). Fewer than that and they just go in a bag to get smooshed.
author: Kayleigh S.

description: Teeny tiny store front...packed with delicious bite size desserts. Every single bite was so good. A must try. I didnt get any chonuts but ill be back to try em. Fyi no parking and on a busy street.
author: Melissa K.

description: The Lower Haight is getting all classy with a new cream puff shop! These bite-sized pastries are miniature works of art. The precious decorative details make them perfect for a personal indulgence or gifting for a special occasion. I tried the hazelnut, passion fruit and rum custard fillings. All were amazing, but if I had to pick a favorite, it might just be the passionfruit. But then again, I haven't tried all 13 flavors yet! ;)
author: Jenny N.

description:
Excited to have a beautiful new bakery specializing in exquisite pastries right in my back yard.  I also generally don't mind spending for good food.  But unfortunately I don't see myself coming back here often, the cream puff was $2.75 per piece for a very small bite.  And it wasn't earth shatteringly great like it would need to be at that cost.  Looked beautiful but didn't taste freshly baked, pastry too dense, not much cream.

If you're tempted like I was to try these cream puffs, I suggest going to Thorough Bread bakery at Church and Market instead, their puffs are melt-in-your mouth delicious, 3x as big and priced at 3 for $3.50.
author: Bethany N.

description:
I finally went to Choux bakery. This is the best cream puff ever. On my first visit, I only had one - the chocolate flavor - sophie. I was trying to be good and not eat it right at the store, but I could not wait till I am home to eat it. So I had it in the car. The first bite was such a dreamy indulgence experience.  I was so tempted to turn the car around to get more. I was proud to have such self control, but not for too long.

I went back the next day for 6 more and 16 coquettes!! Between me and my 8 yr old son, we finished them in a few minutes.

I told everyone at work and they were all so interested. How could they not? Not only they are luxuriously delicious, but they just look like gems. So we ordered them for one of our meeting. After a few seconds of ooh-ing and ahh-ing, they were gone instantly. 

So glad to have this store in our city. Laura makes these cream puffs to perfection. Finally another options beside cupcakes in town.
author: Christine W.

description: These cream puffs area so cute and delicious.  They are the perfect size. The place itself is small so you'll be eating your cream puffs to go. Presentation of these beauties are great.
author: Sandra S.

description: Unfortunately when I initially walked by today and saw they were finally open, I already had an ice cream cone from Three Twins in my hand. So my brain told me to walk on. Half an hour later, my brain told me since I still had 10 minutes left of my lunch, I could make it there and back. So I listened to my brain again. The selection is gorgeous and I chose one with a passion fruit filling. It was a very delicious bite but at $2.75 a piece its going to be reserved as a special treat.
author: J. P.

description: Oh man, these little guys are so cute and good! At first, I thought they were crazy for charging so much but decided to try them out based on Yelp reviews. YUMMMMMY! I've never had anything like it before. I just wish they weren't so expensive!
author: E C.

description: Amazing litte patisserie !!! The cream puffs are to die for and so much better than beard's papa. The size is perfect and the quality is just wow. The passion fruit is one of my favorite, but honnestly they are all delicious. Much much better than cupcakes or macarons.
author: Benjamin C.

description: The cream puffs were delicious, and Laura, the owner was super nice and welcoming. The shop is small, but cute, and has a very homey feel to it. I'm really glad I stumbled across this place, it's great for dessert and also for gifts!
author: Tome K.

description:
You feel like you are in France. The puffs are delicious and look perfect. The people working there were personable and had smiles on their faces.
The shop is designed in a way to make you want to walk in and you feel the delight even before you actually eat a puff. The box that the cream puffs go in to take home are also so perfect! My favorite flavor is lemon which is called Sunny.
author: Miryum M.

description:
what i ordered... hazelnut and pistachio creem puffs

The prettiest, tastiest, smallest and THE most expensive cream puff I ever had.

$2.50 each the size of a toddler bite, this would be a definite fiver if it wasn't for the price or the lack of an elegant place with a golden toothpick to enjoy the product.

ambiance... ok (a chic pinhole in a wall)
service... ok (stoic but patient)
cost... $- (very expensive)
author: Gors P.

description: BAH! was in the area and noticed it was CLOSED on a Saturday...hmmm...maybe they dont get a lot of foot traffic/business on that day? Seemed odd but ended up getting goodies at Cafe Soleil. Will try again another time...
author: Cheryl M.

description: Choux is a delightful little cream puff bakery that I will now start to frequent as often as I can. Once I walked in I was greeted with Laura's beaming smile and a host of delicious little puffs to try. I particularly enjoyed the rum cream puff, the lemon, and the apple caramel one (I forgot the name). The hot chocolate reminded me of France in a tasty reminiscence of my travels. All three were very unique and what I appreciate the most is how much time and effort Laura puts into each puff. You can taste the love in each bite. Also the whole place is kosher! What a plus for all those Jewish businesses who want amazing scrumptious deserts! Highly recommended
author: Talia S.

description: The bakery was so cute. The service was very friendly. And the choux pastries were as adorable as can be... BUT. They were disappointing in taste and texture. If I had closed my eyes and eaten one of these without knowing where they came from, I would rate it these two stars. Unfortunately, this is the one case where it tasted NOT as good as it looked. The crust?/dough was soggy, the topping was colorful but bland, and the filling was average. Very sad.
author: k k.

description: Came here when it first opened. I was super excited to try these cute beautiful cream puffs. First of all, this place is ridiculously  overpriced for a single cream puff. I understand it looks beautiful and takes a lot of work but it doesn't justify the $2.75 cost. It was literally a bite. Secondly, the taste was nothing special. I have had way better cream puffs at Beard Papas.
author: Vivian N.

description: Hell no for the price.  Rather have beard papas.  Cute but cream and texture of the pastry wasn't a hit.
author: Amy C.

description:
Came here to try the chounuts and ended up having to wait 15 minutes because they had none ready. They were well worth the wait. 

The lady who made them for us even compensated us with a few small other treats for being patient. All around, a nice (but expensive) day treat. 

$9 for two chounuts.
author: Adam H.

description:
Laura's choux are delicious and have both a subtle taste and design.

As a Frenchman, I have eaten a lot of choux in my life: from Le Notre's choux for wedding cakes to those from La Maison du Chou in Paris for tea time.

A good chou requires a good balance between a slightly crusty shell, a tasty filling (not too dense nor too liquid, right balance of sugar and butter), and a good presentation.

When I first came to Choux Bakery, I was surprised and impressed by this lovely tiny place, pretty much in the middle of nowhere (the contrast with other shops around is fun). I thought that the showcased choux were a good reflection of the refined and tasteful style of the three girls working there. 
I investigated a little and got to meet Laura in person who told me about her story and how she left everything she was doing to dedicate herself to her passion for choux.

I ended up buying a box of 6 choux (even the box itself was nice) and brought it to a diner I was invited. It was a success and everybody asked me were these little gems were coming from.

Definitely recommending the place for a nice gift for a friend (gf loved it), bringing for diner or just to grab a couple of choux and hot chocolate (got a trial cup - delicious) around tea time when hanging in Lower Haight.
author: Boris V.

description:
I cannot say this enough: I AM SO EXCITED CHOUX IS OPEN!

Gone are the days of tantalizing photos of cream puffs covering the store front windows because Choux Bakery has opened its doors for business. And this adorable little French bakery/cream puffery is selling the most unbelievable sweet treats.  

The decor of this shop is absolutely worth mentioning as you feel like you are transported to a tiny shop in Paris from the moment you walk in. It's obvious the owner paid meticulous attention to every detail, and it does not go unnoticed. From the beautiful stainless steal machinery, to the staff's uniforms, to the personal touches (one of the shop's walls is a blow up photo of the owner baking with her mother), to the cream puffs themselves, this place is beautiful masterpiece. 

As for the cream puffs...... there are no words! I just can't stop! You can never have just one (like with Pringles "once you pop, the fun don't stop"). The flavors are so unique and the proportions of all of the ingredients are just right.The decor of each cream puff is as stunning as the shop itself. 

The owner of Choux is lovely. She is the perfect embodiment of all that the shop represents. If you are stuck between flavors she's the one to ask! 

I also highly recommend you try the chouquettes if you want a little something sweet to start off your morning!

Choux I'd give you 10 stars if I could.
author: Lauren J.

description:
I was really anxious to see this open, so this is a hard review to write. 

What I like about these "authentic French" cream puffs is that they are bite-sized, unlike the monsters you get at Beard Papa and other places. The fillings are delicious!

There are a couple things, though, I don't like.  First, the $2.75 per piece price tag.  For a bite.  Yikes!  Second, the pastry was not as flaky as I expect from a cream puff.  Maybe it's more authentic?  Third, because of the small size, there's a higher pastry to cream ratio, and it feels like you barely get a taste of the filling (which is really good) - I'd like more to savor.  Finally, also because of the size, the toppings tend to dominate the flavor profile, and they are the least important part of the puff.  For example, I had a raspberry cream filled puff, and all I tasted was the raspberry on top.  The berry was delicious, but I wish I'd removed it so that I actually tasted the puff & cream.

Because I was sharing with my hubby, I only got half of each of 6 puffs - we both wanted to try them all.  We tried a hazelnut, vanilla, 2 types of chocolate, a raspberry and a pistachio. Maybe if you pop the whole thing in your mouth at once, you get a better experience.  But remove the topping first!  

I will try them again, eating all in one bite, to see if they work for me.  But otherwise, I wouldn't be back.
author: Allison K.

description: These are delicious! But definitely pricey. There weren't a lot of options since I came near closing time, so come here earlier on in the day if you can. What I got to try was the Strawberry, the Lemon Meringue, and the Hazelnut. The Hazelnut was my favorite out of the bunch and I enjoyed the crispy outside layer and the creamy insides. A little bit pricey for my taste so I'll come here only for special occasions.
author: Stefanie K.

description:
This place is specializing in one thing (cream puffs) and getting it right. 

So far, I've tried just one: the pistachio flavored one with the marzipan icing and it was a showstopper. Beautiful/delicious way to pep up the afternoon. 

I'm not big on sweets, so one was enough for me... good thing since the $2.75 price is pretty steep! But, in this case, you get what you pay for.
author: Angela K.

description: great little cream puffs filled with flavors so tantalizing that they make you want to buy them all! my favorite, of course, was the chocolate mint that flavor profile is one of my all time favorites so that's a given. they ARE pretty expensive for something that lasts no more than two bites maximum though. but I guess that's a good thing or anybody who discovers this place would end up looking like the humans on Wall-e.
author: Regina C.

description: Had some of these at an event and fell in love. Had to stop by and get some last weekend at the shop. Not too messy to pick up ( a few at a time ) and perfectly crunchy on top. Pro tip, try the chocolate.
author: Max S.

description: C'est magnifique !  Unique, creative, delicious! Need I say more?
author: Margot M.

description: I had the cream puff with chocolate filling. It was $2.50 which is pricey for the size. But it did taste pretty damn good and if I am in the area I will be back.
author: Chital S.

description: Amazing Cream Puffs. Some of the best I have ever tasted. I would definitely return and purchase more. However -1 star due to the pricing of them....
author: Paul L.

description: Cute little place, but prices are a little ridiculous. They charge nearly 3 dollars for an incredibly tiny cream puff. It's delicious, but small. Slightly bigger than a quarter. Bite-sized. Fun-sized. Whatever you wanna call it. Small.
author: Tanya S.

description: Delicious! Very moist and has the right amount of sweetness to it. My favorite is the lemon curd meringue!
author: M L.

description: Cream puffs are exquisitely presented and made with top notch ingredients. Staff is helpful and has a great variety of flavors. Always stop by when I'm in the area.
author: John A.

description: Best cream puffs in the Bay Area! I love CHOUX! We had them cater a work party and everyone loved them. They can even customize with your logo! The staff is very friendly & I always love stopping by for a French hot chocolate! From birthday parties, work events, and weddings, Choux make a nice dessert for any occasion. The owner Laura (from Paris) did a great job with this cute bakery in the Lower Haight. Be sure to go early because they sell out early each day as they're made freshly everyday. Make sure to check it out & you'll have a sweet day!
author: LB D.

description: I'm off the cupcakes & macarons and onto these creampuffs. The puff is perfect, the cream is light yet rich and delicious. I could fit probably 4 in my mouth at once, but I don't recommend it no matter how tempting it might be.
author: Sara C.

description: The artisan cream puffs here are made with TLC and great attention to detail. They taste unique and looked so good I didn't want to take a bite! I got a half dozen with a variety of flavors. I enjoyed the dark chocolate with coconut the most but the others were delicious as well. The shop is small but I think that adds to the charm. This is a local San Francisco business that should be supported. The puffs would be a really special desert to have at a wedding or fancy party.
author: Brian H.

description:
I am usually not a fan of the entire concept of cream puffs, but this place was such a pleasant surprise! 

I was stomping home from errand running, having a particularly frustrating time doing so. I passed Choux and walked in out of the pure need to treat myself and figured I would give the place a try. The shop is very tiny (I had to wait outside as a man and his wife were there with their baby in a stroller and that maxed the entire space,) but the beautiful pastries (seriously, so well-decorated) kept me intrigued. They're slightly overpriced, but I must say, the personified names and the descriptions give you a good idea of what you're getting and man, do these sweets deliver! You can tell that the taste is delicate, the right amount of sweetness and that the flavor combinations were well thought out. 

Overall, Choux is delicious! It says a lot to me when a restaurant/shop can help me like an item I normally don't. Price is steep though--$3+ is a lot to pay for something that's barely the size of a ping pong ball.
author: Ari R.

description: Someone brought the cream puffs to a party, wonderful!  Definitely will be going there.
author: Joannie N.

description: Each cream puff has a semi crunchy, very pleasant exterior. They fill each puff completely with flavored cream (there are a lot of flavors to choose from chocolate, salted caramel, lemon, passion fruit, etc.). It is beautifully packaged and very delicious. I cannot stress enough how delicious it is. However, each puff is no bigger than the size of your thumb. At $3 per puff ($15 for 6), it is definitely a luxury. If you can splurge, go for it, but don't go in thinking it is the size of a Beard Papa. They are miniature puffs.
author: George L.

description: Tried Choux for the first time today and bought half a dozen. They're quite small and are shells with fillings. Not to my taste, One star for the service there, too. The young lady helping us wasn't too friendly On the other hand, the strawberry meringues were very good.
author: W. W.

description: I have been to most of the best pastry shops in Paris, and in the "choux" category this place offers the very best. San Francisco is finally getting serious about desserts!
author: Romain D.

description: Seriously I preferred Beard Papa!!! This is like French macaron, cute to look at with fancy packaging but it's alright. $2.75 for a piece!!!! The crust is hard, the cream, beard papa does it better. Even beard papa in Japan thousands time better and cuter. Needs to improve on the pastry first. Cute tiny patisserie tuck in lower Haight.
author: Clemencia S.
